means: 铆接( rivet的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: He was riveted to the John Wayne movie.
sentence.Network_cn: 他对约翰·韦恩的电影很痴迷。

sentence.Network_en: I was absolutely riveted by her story.
sentence.Network_cn: 我完全被她的故事吸引住了。

sentence.Network_en: My attention was riveted by a slight movement in the bushes.
sentence.Network_cn: 我的注意力被灌木丛中的轻微晃动吸引住了.

entry.def: If you are riveted by something, it fascinates you and holds your interest completely.

example.ex: As a child I remember being riveted by my grandfather's appearance...
example.tran: 我记得小时候觉得祖父的相貌很迷人。

example.ex: He was riveted to the John Wayne movie...
example.tran: 他对约翰·韦恩的电影很痴迷。

entry.def: A rivet is a short metal pin with a flat head which is used to fasten flat pieces of metal together.

auth_sentence.content: This mixture kept me riveted from start to finish.
auth_sentence.res_content: This mixture kept me riveted from start to finish.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This mixture kept me riveted from start to finish.

auth_sentence.content: Twitter was less reverent, but no less riveted.
auth_sentence.res_content: Twitter was less reverent, but no less riveted.

auth_sentence.content: His legs riveted in a professional gunman's solid stance.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: His legs riveted in a professional gunman's solid stance.
